history.content:
Great questions. You should definitely be able to do all these things, whether you actually can at this time in the new system, I'm not sure. 

Typically, I believe you would use the "My Academics" tab to see your transcript, there you would see the list of schools you've attended and units earned. Obviously this isn't working for you but should be in the next month or two? In future you will also be able to audit your degree to see all your requirements, which are fulfilled and how. In the meantime, you could use assist.org to find your community college and see which courses transfer. 

Send me an email at nicolemcintyre@berkeley.edu with the CC(s) you attended and your SID #. I've screenshot some of the info that might be helpful to you.
You can try running a Degree Audit Report as well! But if you're a freshman, I think it does take a little time for the university to process the transcripts and stuff.

Hi, I'm an L&S CS intended student with some credit from approved community college courses. Is there any way to check which university/breadth requirements I have satisfied? I'm still not sure if Berkeley has received all of my transcripts yet, so I want to be sure that I send in all required documents again if I need to.

Also, is there a way I can check my total number of units (including those from AP exams)? All I see on my CalCentral My Academics tab is that I am a Freshman (but no specific unit count). Since I also took a good number of AP exams, does this mean that my information hasn't been updated yet?

Sorry about the lengthy post, and thank you in advance!
history.subject: Checking Requirements/Accumulated Units
